TopicTitle: What’s the first thing you’ll do in ksp2?

Articles.Content:
33 minutes ago, blueskiesspacetechnologies said:

I will make a HUGE rocket and send it to another star system. I CAN'T WAIT!!

I share your enthusiasm! Also, welcome to the forums!
build an Orion ssto.
I’m gonna play science mode...I am way, way to lazy to ply career. I tried it, I just can’t do it. (Career is also incredibly buggy on console)
A human kerbal sacrifice.

I think I'll try to go through the game at first in career mode just to progress through it as it's meant to be done, then when that gets too tedious I'll switch to sandbox and explore all the other features.
Strap a booster to a pod and fly.
the very first thing? open the game of course! wait, you mean actually doing stuff? ill just strap a pod onto the biggest booster and see how far it will go!
I'll do a replica of my latest, fully stock Hang-O-Base!

Probably take that metallic hydrogen engine that the devs said to never ever ever EVER use in atmosphere, and fire it at full throttle on the launchpad (and be disappointed when only the rocket explodes...)
Build a rocket, forget to check my staging, and fall unceremoniously to the launchpad when I press space
Spoiler
Make an interstellar starship and ram a planet at near light speed

11 minutes ago, Bej Kerman said:

Make an interstellar starship and ram a planet at near light speed

Make an interstellar starship and ram a kerbal at light speed.
I'm probably going to start a carrer save and slowly progress around the game
No comments in a while...dang. Over a thousand views, man that was my most successful thread yet. Shame that no one is still posting in it, I liked seeing what people were saying. Oh well...
I'll first recall what's that.
I'll get used to the UI, and see how many boosters I can add to a command chair.
Build an Orion plane and buzz the tower with it.
Holy Jebediah this is hard

I remember playing the tutorials and then getting to the ones for the mun. Everything always went fine, until landing. I could never control the ship enough to land without crashing, by doing the way the tutorial wanted, which was going "sideways" while dropping alt until the last moment. And then somebody suggested going to minmus first cause it was easier, and voila. Landed on the first try. And getting the feel for it, I proceeded to land on the mun, and then explore the whole system many times over, in many different ways...

Can't wait to take baby steps again. I hope KSP2 adds enough change or realism or complexity or whatever to get even experienced ksp players to have to take a few hard but rewarding baby steps.
Thinking about this some more I think I might have a good look at working out how to land and re-use a lower stage launch vehicle.

Let’s get this to be on the same level of hopes and wishes for ksp2 you guys!

whoo hoo!

On 5/23/2020 at 10:27 AM, Pikapolar said:

Build an Orion plane and buzz the tower with it.

bonus points for buzzing the tower from interstellar space and burning up after leaving the atmosphere.

will look at multiplayer, test the positioning system mainly ground and jitter, look at timewarp subspace system then onto the modding aspect and somewhere in there i will be buying 2 extra copies of the game for @godarklight and @dagger. (yes i said that in public and yes i mean it)

Edited May 25, 2020 by Redneck

36 minutes ago, Redneck said:

will look at multiplayer, test the positioning system mainly ground and jitter, look at timewarp subspace system then onto the modding aspect and somewhere in there i will be buying 2 extra copies of the game for @godarklight and @dagger. (yes i said that in public and yes i mean it)

U wot m8
